body_html: Typical application of TensorFlow is non-deterministic even in single-threaded .run because of non-deterministic ops such as reduce_sum on GPU. But I've seen cases when locking was justified because it made training faster (ie, each iteration was slower, but bigger cost decrease)
body_text: Typical application of TensorFlow is non-deterministic even in single-threaded .run because of non-deterministic ops such as reduce_sum on GPU. But I've seen cases when locking was justified because it made training faster (ie, each iteration was slower, but bigger cost decrease)
body: Typical application of TensorFlow is non-deterministic even in single-threaded .run because of non-deterministic ops such as reduce_sum on GPU. But I've seen cases when locking was justified because it made training faster (ie, each iteration was slower, but bigger cost decrease)
